data.text: @Keyahna95824765 Don’t think that’s the case- at this stage we know that the people who were presenting with symptoms are suffering from the flu, which has been known to produce inaccurate results before. There will be an investigation into what happened though.
@CBadcock @migga At this stage all we know is a team of medical scientists will be conducting a full investigation into how this happened, so hopefully we’ll get answers.

@HanBarry93 Posives: in this case a false positive result and the response taken I believe was a good one.  Think if it was the other way ... a false negative, the outcome would be frightening.

What the report does not mention is what platform....PCR or RAT.  Very vague indeed.
@HanBarry93 @migga That seems an extraordinarily high number of false positives.  Has there been a mistake in the lab?  Has anywhere in Aus. experienced anything close to that?
@HanBarry93 Is their dna different to all be false positives? Genuine question
